subject: Re: [junit] junit.framework.TestCase.getName()(junit 3.8.x) equivalent in JUnit4.0 ??
msgSnippet: Vasudevan, Unfortunately, by design, your test code can not currently find out about the environment in which it s run.  However, Gabriel Cooper has recently
messageBody:
Vasudevan,

Unfortunately, by design, your test code can not currently find out
about the environment in which it's run. However, Gabriel Cooper has
recently been mailing the list looking for a solution, and it looks
like he's made some headway using a custom runner. Gabriel, any
thoughts? Thanks,

David Saff

On 1/9/07, Vasudevan Kalyanaraman <vkvasudevan@...> wrote:
> Hello David
>
> thanks for your concern and help.
>
> Well, the getName() method was used for geeting the name of the test which is used to dump a log of what's happening with the tests...
> e.g. If i run a test class with 10 methods, then the log for every test method is kind of enclosed by its name...The setup and teardown methods print this...
>
> All i need is the name of the current test during runtime...would the junit 4.0 Description.getDisplayName be of some help?
> Have you used this before
>
> Regards
> Vasudevan
>
>
> ----- Original Message ----
> From: David Saff <saff@...>
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Monday, January 8, 2007 7:03:33 PM
> Subject: Re: [junit] junit.framework.TestCase.getName()(junit 3.8.x) equivalent in JUnit4.0 ??
>
> Vasudevan,
>
> Since test classes no longer have a common base class in JUnit 4,
> there's not a getName() method that you can call on test objects, as
> you've noticed. Perhaps we can take a step backwards--what have you
> been doing with the test name in JUnit 3.8? Perhaps there's an
> equivalent strategy in JUnit 4 that doesn't require getName. Thanks,
>
> David Saff
>
> On 1/8/07, vkvasudevan <vkvasudevan@ yahoo.com> wrote:
> > Hello,
> > I have been using junit 3.8.x API, especially the TestCase.getName( ).
> > This gives me , during runtime, the current test method name.
> > Now, it time for me to migrate to Junit 4.0. Does any of you know what
> > is the equivalent API call for getName() in 4.0?
> > I have tried to use this as it is in 4.0, due to backward
> > compatability , but a 'null' is returned. Subsequently, i have tried to
> > with various Test runners available with 4.0 but only with
> > OldTestClassRunner i get the correct information back. With the 4.0
> > runner TestClassRunner i get 'null' always.
> > Has any of you used the similar call getName() with junit 4.0 ? I there
> > a similar method in Junit 4.0? or in its extension?
> > Thanks and Regards
> > Vasudevan
